data.title: Large terrain forest cover crash
data.body:
the client will often crash when saving a large map with a large forest over 4mb - during the save process the forest file will be wiped to 0kb and the client will assert 

this can be deceptive when working on a forest in multiple sittings as each time the torque client is reloaded from scratch the forest will use much less ram than the full amount of memory required for the whole forest if created in one sitting

it would be nice if the client could maintain the amount of memory the forest is using when you first load the game and unloaded areas of the forest as you flew around instead of the memory usage increasing and never freeing as you view the entire forest

having more ram free (as in the torque 32bit 1.75gb ram limit) seems to help save forest files even if the forest is over 4mb in file size

data.title: Removes a duplicated addField( "correctMuzzleVector",...) entry
Enabling oculus, leap, and hydra modules, game crashes on exit.
data.body:
When you make a project with oculus rift, razer hydra, and leap motion modules enabled, running the game and closing it results in a crash.

Steps to reproduce:
1. In the project manager click "New Project".
2. Click "Choose Modules".
3. Select Extended Move class.
4. Check Leap Motion Controller, Razer Hydra Controller, and Oculus VR Devices.
5. Set the correct sdk paths for each.
6. Create the project.
7. Build the project.
8. Run the game.
9. Exit the game.
10. Observe message: 
project.exe - Application Error.
The instruction at 0x77b6e3be referenced memory at 0x000fadf4. The memory could not be read.

data.title: Underwater caustics default to off
Using Alternative zip layout results in unexpected asset paths
data.body:
Zipping any of the folders in shapes will cause any path references to the meshes or textures within to fail to find the files needed.

When using the alternative zip layout, zips within the art folder are referenced as just the zip name without any of the preceding folders included.  So a zip file of art/shapes/Trees.zip will be referenced as if it's path is just Trees/.  When working with these assets in "art/shapes/Trees/",  all references to meshes assigning textures will use the "art/shapes/Trees/filename.dds" path, that means if you zip the trees directory it will not be able to find the texture since the engine thinks it is in "Trees/filename.dds" instead of "art/shapes/Trees/filename.dds".

This also occurs if you use meshes for a forest brush then zip them later.

data.title: Changes to have Linux dedicated compiling again
data.body: A number of required changes for the Linux dedicated server to compile again.

data.title: Update squish library to compile under Linux
data.body: There is a fix in the libsquish repository to make v1.11 compile under Linux.  http://code.google.com/p/libsquish/  This involves adding an `#include <limits.h>` to a couple of files.

data.title: New PostFx (Underwater, Turbulence, and Camera Based Motion Blur)
Add a default RadioControl Profile and image asset back to the Templates...
Removed both PhysX templates
data.body: Starting with [Project Manager 2.0](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/wiki/Project-Manager) it is easy to add the PhysX physics library (and Bullet physics library) to any project.  The two PhysX templates are no longer required.

data.title: Changes add alpha skybox with lighting.
data.body:
Skyboxes now work with scatter skies and time of day, and have a color and exposure control.  Cloud layers can be set to be in front of or behind the skybox.  Normal skyboxes will not display properly unless the material property is set to emissive.

Blog post with example screenshots and a skybox found here:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22265

data.title: refactored / improved input
data.body:
- refactored input logging: since https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/commit/57d92d522ef592303e4a72b1b9a4e1c1f0593875 it is possible to log normally via the standart Con::printf. The Input::log is not rquired anymore as it was a special workaround to log to a file when the logging was not initialized yet.
- replaced INPUT_LOG with INPUT_LOG_DEBUG as the core input log will always log to the console
  - replaced Input::log with Con::printf (only used when INPUT_LOG_DEBUG is defined)
  - removed lots of duplicate Input::log / Con::\* functions: not rquired anymore as the input will already log to the file at this point.
  - fixed OS version debug when LOG_INPUT was used and UNICODE is defined (wchar/char issues).
- added more recognized devices:
  - improved EnumDevices to enumerate more devices, not just keyboard, mouse and gamectrl
  - added DI8DEVTYPE_FLIGHT and DI8DEVTYPE_1STPERSON to the joystick list: no reason why not to support these device types.
- added new c++ functionality: DInputDevice::getProductGUID(), DInputDevice::getJoystickCount(), DInputManager::getJoystickProductName(), DInputManager::getJoystickProductGUID(), DInputManager::getJoystickID()
- added new script functionality (via c++ functions above): getJoystickCount(), getJoystickProductName(), getJoystickProductGUID(), getJoystickUID()
- replaced hardcoded (always on and fixed to 24%) deadzone with dynamic set-able via script: "pref::Input::JoystickDeadzoneEnabled" / "pref::Input::JoystickDeadzone"

Signed-off-by: Thomas Fischer info@beamng.com

data.title: Oculus Rift - Water deosn't render with transparency in the right eye.
data.body:
When using the oculus rift, any water planes or rivers don't render correctly from the right eye.  Transparency and reflections look drastically different.  

Expected: World renders correctly for both eyes.

Steps to reproduce:
1. In a project with oculus rift support, add a river and water block to a level.
2. Save and play the level with the oculus rift.
3. Observe the water looks different in each eye.

data.title: Skybox scatter sky
data.body:
This allows transparent lit skyboxes that work with scatter skies.

One caveat - for a skybox to be used normally, the material needs to be set as emissive.  Also, an cubemap using an alpha skybox isn't a good choice for a material.

Discussed here at Garagegames.com:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22265

data.title: Vehicle out of control when entering with a gamepad.

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.title: style.css changes for Project Manager modules
data.body:
The style.css defines how some of the Project Manager GUI elements look.
With the buttons for changing a project's modules some changes to this
file are required.

data.title: Particle Editor - New particles are not rendered correctly
data.body:
When you create a new particle emitter, the setting for Soft Distance is set to 1000. This causes the particle to render as if it's behind most or all objects in your scene. If anything is in front of it besides sky, which there usually is, the particles do not render.

Expected: The default settings for a new emitter are set so the emitter is visible.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the World editor.
2. Open the particle editor.
3. Create a new particle emitter.
4. Observe the particles draw behind everything but the skybox.

data.title: Allow T3D to compile against the latest version of FMod
data.body:
FMOD_INIT_SOFTWARE_REVERB_LOWMEM has been removed as of FMOD Ex 44409.
See http://upstream-tracker.org/compat_reports/fmod/44408_to_44409/abi_compat_report.html.

data.title: Project gen2012
data.body: I've updated and added scripts to enable the project generator to create a VS 2012 solution and project set.  It also disables SAFESEH when generating these projects.

data.title: Material Editor Preview - Ambient Light Color is not used in the preview.
data.body:
In the material editor, changing the ambient light color for the preview does not change the lighting in the preview.

Expected: Ambient light color is used in the preview.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the material editor.
2. Change the ambient preview color.
3. Observe the preview lighting does not change.

Note: The Normal Light Color does affect the lighting in the preview, the Ambient Light Color does not affect the lighting in the preview.

data.title: TheoraTextureObject
data.body:
Places a theora video onto a named texture surface that may be used by any material.  Allows for the video to play, pause, stop, loop, and for the source video to be changed at any time.

Based on this resource:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/21019

data.title: Version number change.
data.body: Also adds console functions to get the user's application version.

data.title: Scatter Sky Community Fixes
data.body: Fixes and Extends Features in the Scatter Sky Object and Shaders (22April)

data.title: Project Generator File Copy
data.body:
Project Generator may now automatically copy files needed for a module
into the project's directory.  Use the new copyFileToProject() function
in the module .inc file.  The following modules have been set up for
this:
- FMod
- Leap Motion
- PhysX
- Razer Hydra

These modules have been set up to copy both release and debug files as
appropriate.  When releasing your game you'll likely want to not include
any debug files.
